title: Gwalior
short_description: Experience the legacy of the Scindias in one of India's most imposing fort cities.
long_description:
Gwalior is a city built around an impregnable fort that was once described as the 'pearl amongst fortresses in India'. It is the seat of the Scindia dynasty, one of the most powerful Maratha royal families. The city is a blend of medieval majesty and 19th-century European influence.

The royal highlight is the Taj Usha Kiran Palace. Built to host the King of England, it is a property of immense history and charm. Adjacent to the Jai Vilas Palace (part of which is still the royal residence), a stay in Gwalior offers a peek into the lifestyle of a modern royal family that has seamlessly transitioned into the present day.

properties.title: Taj Usha Kiran Palace
properties.short_description: A 120-year-old palace built to host the King of England, now a Taj heritage hotel.

how_to_reach: Gwalior has its own airport and is a major railway hub on the Delhi-Mumbai line.
